mesh.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: material made from threads or wires that have been woven together like a net, or a piece of this material
mesh.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The windows were covered in wire mesh to keep out flies.
mesh.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a complicated or difficult situation or system
mesh.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: She had felt trapped by the old mesh of loyalty and shame.
mesh.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if two ideas or things mesh, they fit together very well
mesh.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: His own ideas did not mesh with the views of the party.
mesh.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if two parts of an engine or machine mesh, they fit closely together and connect with each other
